Whoops -- nevermind that last comment; it was meant for a different PR.
Regarding to Yihua's proposals: either option is fine with me -- as long as it does not break Envoy ALTS.
Thanks Mark and Jiangtao for the review. All comment are addressed. PTAL

Thanks Alex for the comments. 

Regarding `c-ares` issue, will there be any side-effect if disabling DNS queries for ALTS channel? how will the name of metadata server get resolved if not sending DNS queries? 

Regarding `exec_ctx` issue, I additionally found two other APIs (four in total) that are used in ALTS and could potentially cause the same problem: 

1) `grpc_insecure_channel_create`
2) `grpc_channel_destroy`
3) `grpc_byte_buffer_destroy`
4) `grpc_call_unref`

How about having "internal" versions of above API's as well? or is it fine to invoke them inside gRPC core. I found them being invoked in other parts of gRPC core.

Yes, it would probably be a good idea to add internal versions of any C core API call that creates an `ExecCtx` that is being called from the ALTS code.  Feel free to do that in a separate PR, though.

SG. I will work on it in a later PR then. 

Test failure: https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/17175

```
Regarding c-ares issue, will there be any side-effect if disabling DNS queries for ALTS channel? how will the name of metadata server get resolved if not sending DNS queries?
```

the metadata server can still be resolved from the hosts file, but c-ares will also query for load balancers with an SRV query and a service config with a TXT query
